main event: A civilian observed a round, white object in the sky over Colorado Springs, Colorado on August 18, 1956.
interesting points: The object was about the size of a silver dollar at arm's length.
The object was sighted at approximately 90 degrees azimuth and 10 degrees elevation.
The object was viewed visually for 4 minutes before going slowly invisible when the observer went to grab binoculars.
The object was the same as previously sighted by the same source on August 14, 1956.
The source objected to the object being identified as the planet Venus shining through a temperature inversion.
